Open Internet Manifest

A living manifesto for a free, open and decentralized internet

Thesis 4

The enclosures are almost complete, but the last gate is still open â€” and they know it.

The five gatekeepers are hammering day and night: app stores are becoming stricter fortresses, independent protocols are being starved, open hardware is being banned or made unaffordable.

Yet alternative networks, free servers, open-source operating systems, and communities still operate outside their reach.

We stand on the narrowest edge of history: the moment when collective exit is still possible â€” and when we can choose together to tear that gate open forever.
